sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>narwhal</radical> sticks a <radical>stick</radical> into the <radical>dirt</radical> to see what might <kanji>exist</kanji> underneath it. Narwhals live in the sea, you see. So they're convinced nothing can exist anywhere else.
meaningInfo: Imagine seeing a narwhal sticking a stick, and maybe even its horn too, into the dirt on land. It needs to know if life exists outside of the ocean for sure.
readingMnemonic: The narwhal can't find anything but it can't stop thinking about what could <kanji>exist</kanji> outside of its world. It pulls out a <reading>xy</reading>lophone (<ja>ざい</ja>) and starts tapping the keys with its horn. It plays a sad song about the meaning of life and whether existence is worth it.
readingInfo: Hear the plinky plink of the xylophone and think about what exists in this world. It's a sad song, you realize.
